page.title: 05LONGFORGAN - S.W.R.I -
page.content: Longforgan boasts a thriving Scottish Women's Rural Institute which has recently celebrated its Golden Jubilee. The "Rural" as it is known has a meeting every month in the Bowlers' Hall, consisting of arts and crafts demonstrations, and talks of local and national interest. We are very lucky to still have two founder members, a little infirm perhaps, but always interested in our doings. At our recent birthday party, one of them gave us a most interesting insight into what life was like at the time our Institute started, and on into the war years, telling of how they coped and made-do in the years of shortage after the war. This year we now have a choir and entertainment group, and an icing class, and later on we will have an art class. We try to live up to our motto "For Home and Country".
